poem:
**Bank Holiday Exodus**

Seventeen million cars  
floating on tarmac lanes,  
metal islands adrift,  
radio waves their sails.  
Sunshine dapples dashboards  
as exhaust clouds drift,  
while the rail tracks dream  
of quiet steel underfoot.  
Engines hum to the hum  
of too many summers,  
all in search of an elsewhere  
beneath a wide, indifferent sky.
